result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey D Cobb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessment], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessment], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Due to financial hardship, Court ordered costs, fees and surcharges to be set at no higher than $500.00. Court waived the DNA surcharge as no DNA sample was taken. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Cash bail applied.
- No firearms; weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Supervision by the Mental Health Unit, Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Successfully complete " Batterers intervention" counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact and then only after the Court has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.

Defendant Jeffrey D Cobb in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 10/23/15.
-Supervision by the Mental Health Unit, Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Due to financial hardship, Court ordered costs, fees and surcharges be set at no higher than $500.00.  Court waived the DNA surcharge as no DNA sample was taken.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey D Cobb in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40
Case set for return of Doctor's Report.  Doctor's Report received and filed.  Doctor's report read by parties. Defendant found competent to proceed.  Parties do not dispute the findings and Court reinstates the proceedings. Defense counsel requests case be set for a Plea Hearing. Matter set for a plea hearing in branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Case set for return on doctor's report.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Branch 23 agreed to take the case for this hearing.  rmm

Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Calendar call scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.  rmm

Case set for plea hearing.  Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit on 4/08/15 at 10:30 am. Order For Competency Examination, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit. Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 40.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey D Cobb in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Jeffrey D Cobb in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Defense moves to dismiss Count 3 for lack of probable cause.  State moves to amend probable cause portion of complaint.  Court grants request and orders paragraph 2, 2nd to last sentence of the probable cause section amended to reflect the correct time of 3:50 am.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
